Reviews.Title: “not bad for this price”
Reviews.Author: ira2010
Reviews.Content: Very affordable price for Boston, and the service was (overall) not bad, rooms were clean and quiet. The toilet had occasional loud noises after flushing, and occasionally we did not have a complete set of towels. The room didn't have a microwave, but had a fridge and a free internet. Finding how to get there from a main road took a while, but after that all travelling was good. Parking is free. It is a nice contrast with the Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers - there we paid 45$ per day for parking, 12.5$ for internet, no fridge or micro in the room, for a higher daily rate!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy AC”
Reviews.Author: HolyDistance
Reviews.Content: Geographically not very good, kinda cheap though. The worst part is the extremely loud AC, woke me up always, and the suggested solution from them is simply turning it off and giving you more blankets

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Urban Visit”
Reviews.Author: MikeHydro2013
Reviews.Content: If you wish to see a City full of Architecture, Art, Museums, ride the T to almost all places and walk through the snow this is a good developing site; the development is of the shopping park and local work places, frequented by cats in the giant yards and seagulls still looking for the Port of the Tea Party. The best T however was the train sub, near to Andrew T and with its own bus to the station this Hotel reaches most of Boston, ill supplied with maps and tea in the rooms and decent Planning but filled with built form of each sort of an Architect's dreams, without coordination, but the Big Dig made Boston walkable apart from the tree roots and some of the paved brick that has come apart. Watch your feet for the pieces of metal sticking in the paving in odd places and the litter. Boston needs a Big Vacuum on a large mechanized machine. Machines are large in Boston, that alone makes it a good Boys visit, the white line crossings need care, but if they turn in and run you down as a bookshop lady complained at lunchtime they are liable. The Hotel was large also, the room great, the bed giant, the bathroom well maintained, the plumber very pleasant although we blocked his toilet late Saturday night, the desk people were great, the help in Boston is good, the books and people working charity for children superb. The coffee was American!, the tea absent except in the main concourse, plenty of it, the Hazelnut Milk is great in coffee. Internet OK, relaxation and the Jacuzzi and swim small but very welcome and well maintained. The staff would talk with us that made it great. Very accommodating, I think we were not the easiest customers as first English to land from Somerset ? with questions on simple matters. Breakfast here is booked at table but was great. Wife made and filled herself with Waffle, not her usual trend! This site is fairly new it will become better as companies take over empty sites, the traditional housing around was good, we also saw some coastal and old town, very pretty in summer I expect, we were snowed and poured upon, so felt the pain of cotton millers, but when it was shut for commercial reasons they were earning a much better pay than UK equivalent, so hard work long hours and dangerous to health but in the hey day of USA it would have been high living. However what Union workers actually get from company one knows not. The place is still colonial and very well run by the Mexican and Caribbean work force, African American Indian features are common so one is not completely overrun by Boston finance and high rise, streets wide except in old brick paved. The Hotel was a mine of information of a helpful nature and always there to help with a good smile. However if you go inside Spring Winter take Clothing or Visit Macy's the hotel was well heated but you cannot escape Boston winds and it is dry and desiccating for West Coast English, so after landing buy hand cream, lip salve, plenty to drink, everything is bulk and the rental would be good as they will not allow the wonderful fish slab cooking in the rooms. But stick rigidly with the rules on travel and accommodation, the TSA took the lock off my case, I thought I had been robbed, then left a courteous note inside of a routine check, so I was glad there was no dirty washing, as you can wash everything at this hotel or send it out if you prefer. I took too much but was very glad of the woollens and coat, hats you need hats and gloves, Great visit, thank you. Never saw a Beaver, they obvioulsy have more sense than us English in winter and deserts as the saying goes about the midday sun. Do visit the Muddy. Take a boat trip too. All well set up and wander about with a camera and a pencil, you can draw at Isabella Gardener it is encouraged, they have my eraser my wife "put back" so you can use that too, it is a High Quality Craft shop version for the airplane, which was not as tedious as expected, or buy one of the eraser bears you can find in shops. Visit Red Mango at Hewitt's Cove Hingham, wonderful, even for a boat trip afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option outside the city!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravWayne_NJ
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one night at the Courtyard Boston-South Boston. Selected location because of the FREE parking and proximity to city. My GPS did not recognize address but if you call the hotel they'll give you a different address--Allstate Street. The hotel is behind a Best Buy and central shopping plaza. There is an Applebees, Panera Bread and Olive Garden at the plaza so you can easily find places to eat or grab a snack. I did use the internet while there and found it to be quick and easy to access. Overall hotel is clean and well maitained. Couch in room was "worn" but for a one night visit that was okay. Excellent option for thrifty travelers seeking a safe, reliable and convenient location while in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in South Boston”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: Free parking, clean, quiet, convenient location. Right off 93. Shuttle to the T every half hour or a 8 minute walk. Alternately stay in downtown Boston for more than double the price and then pay $40 a day to park!

Reviews.Title: “Great price in a Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4infamily4
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for college visits and found this hotel through the Marriott website. It was much less expensive than any of the other Marriott Hotels, even those that were farther away. The hotel is right off the I-93, and easily accessible from the highway. It is set back a little from the noise and we did not hear any traffic noise that night. Another bonus for Boston hotels, FREE PARKING onsite! The hotel is new, well maintained and very clean. There is an indoor pool and a fitness center. There is a little food and drinks kiosk and a bar on the main floor. Breakfast is not included but is a pretty good value. Full cooked buffet for $12.95. The rooms are clean and fairly large. Queen beds, not doubles. We happened to get a handicap accessible room, so the bathroom was very roomy. As far as little details. Electrical outlets were all very well placed for easy reach. There is a minifridge and a coffee maker with supplies in the room. There is an iron and a hair dryer. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay.”
Reviews.Author: Jtravelady
Reviews.Content: I am someone who travels a lot for work. Typically Marriot is one of my first choices but this one could seriously use some updating. Pro's : Comfy nice beds, clean rooms friendly service Cons: No bar or restaurant) optional delivery but it's overpriced and passe. The Manual in the hotel says complimentary shuttle service to airport. Its actually 5 dollars. The bath faucet poured out yellow brown water and when I complained I got told it was a city thing" * there is a swimming pool. It was 4 feet and probably could hold about 5 adults at most. Hot tub was broken. For what I paid... next time I will go elsewhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LSUFAN67
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boys the night before an early flight out of Boston Logan. We arrived around 5 PM and the boys found the T station an easy walk and headed into Boston for a few hours. I decided to stay back and head to the local shopping area behind the hotel. There is some decent shopping and a few casual restraunts within the short walk. The boys took the free shuttle to the T but just walked on there return said it was completely safe and a short walk. The rooms were clean and appeared to be updated. Front desk staff was friendly and professional. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you need to cancel your reservation”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey H
Reviews.Content: I booked the Courtyard in South Boston for my husband and I for a weekend in October 2011. The night before we were supposed to leave, we received a devastating phone call that my husband's mother had passed away. I immediately called the hotel to cancel, since we needed to be home with the family and help with arrangements. My husband is in the Navy and we live several hours away. The lady that answered the phone said it was "no problem" to cancel our reservation and that we would not be charged a cancellation fee due to the circumstances, and they also had 18 hours notice before our check-in time. Turns out, they charged our credit card anyway. It was my fault for not getting a name and cancellation number, but I was grief stricken at the time and not thinking clearly. So beware if you need to cancel your reservation, even in the event of an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “Better with a car”
Reviews.Author: PopcornB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business in November 2011. Most hotels in Boston are easily accessed by public transport, but the nearest subway stop here is Andrew, a brisk 10 min walk for someone reasonably fit, but at least a 20 min walk with a heavy suitcase (even on a sunny day, mid afternoon). There are some local buses that run past the hotel, but only about 3 an hour. Once at the hotel, the big shopping park with Target, TJMaxx etc is useful for late night shopping, but walking through the car park next to the freeway is strange. Hotel itself is modern and comfortable, I was given an accessible room which was spacious and warm. Large, new bed, free reliable Wifi. The 'pool' is tiny, barely room to swim a few strokes, and the hot tub was out of order for 2 of the 4 nights I stayed - when it was working it did the job nicely. Didn't use the small gym, but could see that at least 1 of the 6 machines was out of order. Staff at front desk. very helpful, stored bags after I'd checked out, shuttle to airport was about $6 and it took about 10 mins to the terminal. Would stay again, but only if travelling with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Courtyard - good location”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. Location was good, easy to get into Boston center, shopping plaza across the street. Up to Courtyard standards, you get what is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: Cozee
Reviews.Content: When you drive up to the hotel the first thing you see is are all of the Christmas lights around the entrance. A welcome sight to the weary traveler. The front desk staff were all cheery and in the holiday mood and check and check out was fast. The rooms and the hotel in general were very clean and well maintained. We parked our car and walked to the mall behind the hotel for dinner at Applebees and picked up some pastries for breakfast at Starbucks. The only thing missing was a restaurant on site for dinner and breakfast so we had coffee in the room with pastries for breakfast. I would stay here again as the price and the location are good(once you find the hotel). Tip: The manager suggested in an earlier post that you program your gps for Allstate road. I did that and drove in circles in the mall around the best buy. You have to drive past the best buy in the mall towards where you see all the traffic on I 93. Just short of I93 you have to take the access road to the hotel to the right. It is well marked when you reach that point but I had to stop and call the hotel to learn of the access road's existence.

Reviews.Title: “One night before a flight”
Reviews.Author: amlunchlady
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight to catch the day after Thanksgiving so we booked a night here. It is a very nice, well kept, well styled, still smells kinda new hotel. Due to the fact that we arrived on Thanksgiving night we had limited options for food or drink (hotel services were closed). We went out in search of a convenience store hoping to find a beer and soda and snacks for our evening in the room and also pick up some breakfast items as we would miss the hotel food in the morning due to our early flight. This proved to be difficult as MA has blue laws and so there was no beer to be found. The convenience store did have all the other things we needed though, so no harm no foul.... just a word of caution to other potential travellers, if you want a beer I am not sure where you'll find it if the bar is closed. The staff was friendly and even though they could not help us find a scale to weight our bags, they were very gracious with their appologies. All in all it was a good noghts stay.

Reviews.Title: “Have returned year after year”
Reviews.Author: mapsNH
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel annually for the past few years for a conference I attend at the Boston Convention Center. The rate can't be beat compared to the other hotels and it offers free parking and free shuttle service the to Convention Center (a savings of at least $120). I also took the T and they sent a shuttle to pick me up so I didn't have to walk. The location is tricky to find but if you look for the South Bay Shopping Center, it is located behind that. The rooms were clean and modern looking and the bed very comfortable. I did not use the pool but the gym was adequate. The front desk staff was always friendly and accomodating. This year, the GM emailed me prior to my stay (nice touch!) and answered some questions I had. The only thing I miss is complimentary breakfast but they offer coffee and tea around the clock. Will definitely be staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard South Boston is everything you expect from Courtyard, but what you'll get is great service at an affordable price. I've stayed here on several occasions and received tremendous service - complimentary breakfast, convenient transportation to & from Andrews Red Line station, and good recommendations from hotel staff. As much as I enjoy staying at the other Marriott properties in the area, this South Boston location easily offers the best value, so you can relax and spend more on your nights out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free parking, but not out of ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Rasvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night while in transit through Boston. It was not the best Marriott I can recall. It is a good location and cheaper than downtown. A big plus is that the parking is free. It is close to a shopping mall with Target, Marshalls, Best Buy and much more. The access to the hotel is tricky because it is through the malls parking lot, far around the corner. The service is not special, being a big hotel there are line-ups at the check-in counter and sometimes only one representative to take care of the guests. This is a high traffic hotel with a lot of people coming and going. I asked for a room far from elevators which was no luck as it was close to the staircase. There was traffic far beyond midnight with doors slamming and people talking loud, not the best sleep. In the morning the main door was broken and out of place. The lobby is large but crowded and noisy. The swimming pool is small and has a jacuzzi. Towels were missing but were brought in promptly after seing the front desk. Free coffee and tea is available in the main lobby. The room was the typical Marriott room but found it smaller than the usual. You find here the same ammenities available at other hotels in the chain. As I said, nothing out of the ordinary. If I find myself in the area I would try my luck somewhere else. If you get a great special is worth-it. I had a free night Marriott cupon because I travel a lot so it was free for me but if I would have to pay $200 per night this will not be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: chazurette
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a girls weekend in the city and conference. I was amazed at the prices in the city so this was a nicer option (more than I would normally pay for a courtyard marriott but way better than $300+/night in the city). Everything was as pictured, was updated and clean. Only improvement in the room could have been a mirror outside the bathroom but the shower was great! Front desk staff were not overly friendly but polite. Had our breakfast not come included with the room price I would not have paid the $12+ per person that is normally charged. It was a simple breakfast that most hotels offer for free. Others have mentioned about not feeling safe while walking to the T; we walked several times and had no problems. The hotel can be a bit tricky to find when driving however. Located just behind a large shopping complex with an Olive Garden, Panera, Applebees, and grocery store which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: puff007NewEngland
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure-I am a marriott elite which typically means I'm used to excellent service, potentially freebies and sometimes an upgraded room when I stay at Marriott properties. I mostly stay at small non Marriott hotels when I travel to NYC but outside of that area prefer Marriotts when I have the choice. I stayed over the weekend for one night at the Courtyard South Boston. I was underwhelmed by this hotel, it's average. The room had a decent view. The hotel only has 6 floors so ask for a room on a higher floor if you want a view. The check in clerk seemed busy at our 3'sh check in time but the room was ready. The good: -free parking and a very easy trip into Boston. We had no issues (once we figured out where the hotel was) with getting in/out of the city from this location. -convenient to shopping (target, best buy, etc) if you forgot anything at home -no bedbugs, at least in our room. I check every single time in every hotel I'm in. -wasn't as noisy at night as staying in the city itself. I travel a lot for work so I'm used to it but when traveling with my kid for a random trip, I want him to sleep well. The bad: -my room was not 100% clean. There were hairs in the sink and on the bathroom floor. There were also a few on the blanket. There was an empty ice cream box on the floor with a wrapper/stick in it. We did not complain about this and just picked them up with a tissue. They seemed really busy and that's probably what they would have done anyway. -our TV would not work right at first, the lady at the front desk was nice about it and they came up to fix it while we were at dinner. Minor annoyance, but still, I usually don't have problems like this. One of the marriotts I stayed in had a glass of wine waiting! -the air conditioning was really loud in our room when it is gearing up to reach the temperature on the thermostat. We just wound up shutting it off in the middle of the night, it kept waking the kid/me. Could just be an older room, I'd test it during waking hours if you are staying there. Not their fault but the people next door to us started smoking in their room in the morning. My kid has asthma so we had to check out early. They nicely offered to move us to a different room for the couple of hours but it just wasn't worth it. We just headed to our destination earlier. I really wish people would pay attention to the no smoking signs! The staff was very nice and looked like they were going to go up there and approach them (I hope so!). Maybe I've just had great experiences elsewhere but I will be trying a different hotel when I go to Boston for business in a couple of weeks. I rarely travel for family travel, usually for business and was hoping this hotel would be a good choice for future family trips to Boston. I plan on staying in the city the next two times and see how painful that is before deciding if I will give this property another try.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing facility for weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: bob_pate
Reviews.Content: Checked in Sep 17 early afternoon and left on Sep 19 early morning. After check-in, we dropped our luggage and were out in the City most of the day. Got back to the facility in late evening. Tried to use bathroom and then the real issue encountered. First the bathroom has an enclosed shower; however, the enclosure requires a ceiling height glass door (probably about 5/8â€� thick) to pull in the ledge to prevent the water from running into the rest of the bathroom floor. The door was too heavy that it must have bent the hinges and the door cannot be closed at all. Thus when you take a shower, it spilled water all over the floor â€“ causing the entire floor to get wet. You literally have layer of water on the floor. You canâ€™t even use the toilet without getting your feet wet. Raised this concern to the front office staff. Literally brought the staff to the room and showed the issue. Their response â€“ sorry about it and we canâ€™t do anything at this hour. Tell us in the morning (Sunday) before we leave the facility and see if we can fix it. On Sep 18 morning, we left the facility a daylong outing in the city and prior to leaving, we reminded their staff to fix the issue. We returned back early evening hours. Upon entering the facility, we asked the front desk if they had fixed the issue. The staff acted with a strange face â€“ as if they are not aware of any issue to be fixed. Total shock. Went to the room and noticed that the issue was not resolved. It was too late to change the room as it was getting late and we had to be out early morning. Other issues observed: mold in shower, the room door lock â€“ makes too much noise that it wakes up the guests. This issue seems to be prevalent to all locks in the facility. The flat screen TV â€“ it would not work. We had to bring their staff to the room to investigate and eventually make it work. The mini refrigerator â€“ it gives an impression that it is working; however, it was not unless you crank up the thermostat inside (we found this out 24 hours later). One would think that the housekeeping staff would check some of these basic stuff. It does not seem to be case. The facility looks pleasant from outside. They do provide a shuttle service to the airport - for $5 per person; we did not use this. We did not use other services such as bar, breakfast services and gyms that it offers. I would have given higher rating â€“ if we did not have encountered the above issues. If you are to stay at this facility, please check out your room and make sure that things are in order before too late. Hopefully the management team will address these items in future.

Reviews.Title: “a rainy night in boston”
Reviews.Author: artbon
Reviews.Content: not a bad hotel...just your average courtyard !!! staff was friendly.... rooms were as expected... pretty good value but i usually stay downtown for convenience, so i saved some $$$ this time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MrsTirrell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and infant for one night during a volleyball tournament in Cambridge. We only had minor issues with the air conditioning and breakfast, but I would still reccomend this hotel to anyone. We enjoyed our stay. They reserved a portable crib for me before checking in, which saves space in the car and is important to us. We were also able to check in very early and were able to pick what floor we wanted to be on. The front desk staff was friendly every time we were in the lobby. Our room was clean and comfortable. The room and bathroom were large and the decor & appliances were updated. There is a mini fridge and coffee maker. The only issue we had in the room was the air conditioning. There was a new digital thermostat but it never regulated the temp, it only stayed on or off. The other issue we had was breakfast. We are pinching our pennies a bit and there was no complimentary breakfast. There was a delicious looking buffet but it was $12 a person. There was complimentary coffee all day in the lobby though which I appreciated. Other than those two things we really enjoyed our stay and I would reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in my room”
Reviews.Author: wundys
Reviews.Content: I came in late (it was the day of hurricane Irene) and was given a room on the second floor, room 237 I seem to remember. Sometime during the night I started hearing this noise which at first I thought was rain from the hurricane hitting the windows but later realized in my groggy sleep state was right next to my bed. I had placed a bag which had some snacks in it next to the bed on a chair and a mouse climbed into my bag, chewed through the wrappings and was eating my snack. I saw the mouse leap from my bag when I turned the light on and promptly called the front desk. I had to request another room, the night clerk thought he could send someone up to kill the mouse but I knew that was not practical. It had already ran for cover under the bed and into whatever hole it came out of probably. So they did move my room and te rest of the night was uneventful however the next morning when I spoke to the manager he said they'd have to look into it. He called me later that day and said there was no sign of a mouse and therefore could not make any compensation. He actually made me feel like he thought I was lying. I had even given them the particular snack that the mouse was eating and he said it didn't look like a mouse had been eating it. i requested they setup a trap with that foodstuff in it and they would probably catch a mouse but I never heard back from them. Not very impressed with their customer service and be aware that you could have a mouse eating into your stuff when you sleep on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “"Away in a Manger"”
Reviews.Author: paiiconference
Reviews.Content: We called approx. 30 B&Bs & hotels to find no rooms on Sat. 9/3. The Red Socks were back! We were wishing to stay one night after leaving Cape Cod to meet nephew for dinner in Boston, then travelling to airport in Providence for early flight. Not used to the late night Sat. freeway traffic in Boston, we escaped the freeway and paid a visit to 3 hotels. Thank goodness for the network between hotels .... one hotel (forgot which) called the Marriott South Boston and booked us into a room that just became avail. Thank you to Chester, Courtyard Front Office who made our plight worthwhile.You are the best! And so was the room. I slept in the bed which was the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and cousin Sue in the hideabed who raved about it as well. Thank you sooo much! Mary Beth King Owner/Innkeeper, The Green Cape Cod Bed & Breakfast, Tacoma, WA

Reviews.Title: “Great once you find it!”
Reviews.Author: College-Schlepper
Reviews.Content: During rush hour confusion we turned when we shouldn't have, otherwise this place probably would have been simpler to find. Once we got here all was well. The front desk staff was exceptionally welcoming and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable.We were here for college tours, four of us to a room, and lots of stuff since we started the trip after picking up our son from a 6 week precollege program. FREE parking. Area feels safe. It is near a Polish-American neighborhood with an authentic Polish restaurant, and Polish grocery stores. The Andrews T stop is a short jaunt from the hotel. We parked our car when we arrived and didn't drive again until we left town.The hotel has pool, pool table, small bar area, patio/gazebo, and a large comfortable lobby where guests relax.It was a very nice hotel. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “We will not go back.....”
Reviews.Author: mrspmc00
Reviews.Content: We went on a girls trip to Boston in May to see our Chicago Cubs play at Fenway Park. We ended up staying at this hotel due to our desire to stay at a Marriott property, and it not being outrageously expensive. There is a reason it is cheap. They advertise a shuttle, and tell you they will take you to and from the T station nearby. They did take us, but EVERY time we needed to get back to the hotel, we were NEVER able to get the return trip. Now, the T stop is not in the most wonderful neighborhood, so being a group of ladies late at night after a baseball game is kind of scary. Each time we ended up having to get a cab to take us back to the hotel - and trust me, cabs were not plentiful in this area. We had to wait quite a while. The hotel is almost impossible to find - it is tucked away behind a shopping center with no signs to get to it. The front desk staff, with the exception of one lady, are totally rude and uncaring - the asst. GM is not any better. My best advice: You get what you pay for ( or maybe less than you pay for). Stay elsewhere even if it costs more! I will NEVER go back here.

Reviews.Title: “a room without window !!!!”
Reviews.Author: merlin013
Reviews.Content: we are a family (2 adults and 2 children) booked a suite with one king bed room and a seperate living room with sofabed : a small window (dirty) in the living room and NO window in the room : it was so dark !! The mattress in the sofabed was realyy svery very used and thin. We have requested (2 months before) a rollawaybed but there was no rollawaybed available this hotel is a shame for Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 4cfamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel has airport shuttle ($5/person) and courtesy shuttle to T station. Drivers were helpful and friendly. Never waited more than 5-10 minutes for a shuttle. Front desk staff was professional and attentive. They were quick to remedy any needs that arose. Quiet rooms with enough space for our family of 4 to move around easily. Rooms have mini-fridge and lobby has market area with a microwave and snacks to buy. We rented a car and the hotel has complimentary parking, which is not the case as you stay closer to downton Boston. The Old Town and Duck Tours trolleys also pick you up at the lobby in the morning if you plan to take one of their tours. However, you need to make your own way back. This was our first visit to Boston and it went smoothly from the start by staying here. Overall, a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE IN A VERY EXPENSIVE TOWN!”
Reviews.Author: bostravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: If you want to take a family/couples/friends vacation to Boston and don't want to pay a ton for the hotel room because you want to see all the sights- then stay here! The location is good if you have a car. With a car, it is 4 minutes to Highway 93 and 1 minute to the a Stop & Shop Supermarket. We didn't take the T from there but there is the Red Line stop within a 10 minute walk. The rooms were standard and the check-in was easy. There are 2 computers in the lobby for free internet and printing. It was also a real plus having FREE HOTEL PARKING which is about $30-40 a day for most Boston hotels. The immediate surrounding area was ok, not the super high rent district but not completely unsafe either (Yes of course, you get what you pay for.) But with Boston Hotels being $225-$400 a night, stay here and spend your $$ having fun with all this great city has to offer. The hotel is labeled as "Boston South". It is not technically in South Boston, but very close so worth taking a stroll around Castle Island and having dinner at traditional Southie restaurant Anhreims.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: diamondqueen255
Reviews.Content: Stayed over July 4th weekend and it was our first time in Boston. Received email from manager regarding specifics of our stay and directions. Directions had us going around the block and it was not necessary. Location was within a four minute walk to train station in Andrews Sq. Room was fairly clean although I noticed the carpet next to the walls needed cleaning. Pool area was really small and hot. Marriott member and asked for breakfast upgrade so it was included in rate was accomodated but charged last morning only when checked out and not told. Have washer/dryers but no coin changer and lobby had no quarters. Easy walk behind hotel to shopping Target/Marshalls/Applebees. Took Old Towne Trolley tour which I highly recommend. No one can tell you that they pick up at the hotel around 8:45 so you don't have to find a trolley stop downtown. Biggest frustration is no one can give you clear directions to anywhere. None of the street maps I could find in the hotel included our location so it was harder to find where you were going.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ideal tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Cweis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Courtyard South Boston specifically because of it's proximity to an event at UMASS Boston only a few miles away. It's a typical Courtyard - clean, comfortable, nice decor. I'd definitely stay there again and probably will for the event next year. However, it's important to note that this is NOT the best location if you're a tourist. It's not in downtown Boston, and is next to a highway and a large suburban shopping mall (which does have some chain restaurants). I'm sure there are some shuttle and T options to get into the city if this was your best choice, but a much better choice would be the Courtyard in Copley Square. Or, even the Courtyard in Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Courtyard, A Few Quirks”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good property in the Boston Area - reasonably priced by Boston terms yet close to downtown and Logan. There is a big shopping area close by with restaurant choices (mostly chains). The room was comfortable and well appointed with a flat screen TV, in room coffee, couch, work desk - the things you would expect at any Courtyard. In terms of the quirks - the room was not as clean as I would expect. There was a hair band from a former guest on the floor and dust on the desk. As a Marriott Rewards member, my profile ensures I never get a room by the elevator - except this time - I was right next to the elevator...and the ice machine. This particular elevator makes an unusally loud ring when it arrives at the floor, so I recommend if you stay here that you get a room away from the elevators. Overall, I'd stay here again, but would insist on a better room location.

Reviews.Title: “Most Convenient, Inexpensive Place to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DebArc
Reviews.Content: This was our most recent of several stays at this hotel. Our son goes to college in downtown Boston, so we have tried many different hotels in the area at many different price points over the past 2 years. The Courtyard South Boston is now our hotel of choice. It is new and clean, free wireless and a good breakfast. There is an excellent diner and a Dunkin' Donuts nearby if you want to eat breakfast out. Free parking. And 7-10 minutes to downtown Boston never with traffic. And the price is fantastic. The only drawback is that it is really hard to find - it sits behind a large retail shopping plaza (which is actually nice to have close by!). But once you know where it is, you're set. All the downtown hotels are so overpriced, this is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: zack728
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Boston. The location is about two blocks from the T line. Its the red line stop Andrew. The pool was small and the water was cold. My kids still enjoyed going in after a long day sightseeing. The spa pool water was way to hot for anybody but that all can be fixed. We didn't eat in their restaurant. We picked up breakfast at the Dunken Donuts by the train station. Definitly recommend leaving the car at the hotel and using the T line. Coming from New York, Bostons T line was very easy and fast. Never waited more then 5 min. for the train.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: carleyc13
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston to meet another couple for the weekend. This hotel was perfect for the weekend. The front desk was very accomidating, as I arrived at 8:30 in the morning and was able to check in. The location was perfect, as it was close to a T stop. The shuttle service to and from the airport was wonderful. I called the hotel once I landed and they were there to pick me up in 15 minutes. On the return trip, I spoke the front desk and they told me the shuttle would pick us up at 11:00 and they were right on time. The close proximity to a grocery store, Panera, and Victoria's Diner was wonderful. This was a great trip and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to pay the high prices of downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- but unreliable Shuttle Service...”
Reviews.Author: shepaintsalot
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for an extremely short weekend getaway...Wasted approximately 3 hours of our precious time on unreliable shuttle service. We verified in advance with the hotel, that there no need to make a reservation for the airport shuttle... So upon arrival at 1245a, we went to baggage claim as instructed and called the shuttle number, only to get a constant busy signal. Then we tried calling the hotel directly and the phone rang and rang and rang. Frustrated, we called Customer Service. They had us on hold for almost another half an hour and said there wasn't anything they could do. Finally we took a taxi. We later learned that there phone system had been disabled for maintenance. The hotel reimbursed our taxi fare. The morning of our departure - 730a flight, we had prearranged a wake up call and Shuttle to take us to the airport at 6a. We arrived to the lobby 10 minutes to the hour. The night Shuttle driver was waiting in the lobby for the morning driver to relieve him of his duties....but the morning driver never showed or called. The front desk summons a cab and once more paid our fare. Keep in mind that this shuttle service is suppose to be available 24-7. The hotel stay was clean and nice, hotel staff was great, but unfortunately, We probably wouldn't go back, or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a weird area”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that the hotel itself and the staff were top-notch. Everyone was friendly and helpful, the rooms were large and very clean, and the location (map-wise) was less than 3 miles from most of the major attractions in Boston. The weirdness came in due to the physical location of the hotel -- tucked behind a Best Buy store and adjacent to some abandoned buildings -- which led to a feeling of insecurity when driving back to the hotel late at night. All in all, it was a good stay, but just a very strange location for this place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Audreybella
Reviews.Content: I cannot complain about the hotel. Free parking, walking distance to the subway, Target and a few chain restaurants within walking distance as well. Free wifi in the room, fridge, comfy beds, clean rooms, plenty of towels daily!!! Really cannot complain! We only found out the last night that we were 10$ away by cab to downtown. Oh well, live and learn! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: whitneypoz
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel this past week. I would reccommend this hotel and would for sure stay there again. The front desk service was awesome! George will for sure help you with any and all questions you may have. The location was ok...five min walk to the subway and close to the airport but a subway or cab is definitely needed to see any sights i.e. Fenway, Harvard, the harbour, as it is located in the south Boston industrial part. The rooms were very clean and in good condition. The hotel is next to target and other various stores as well as some good restraunts. All in all I would have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: grkjetsetter
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average. Good clean rooms. Staff friendly. Location is outside of the city but easily reached via the T on the redline. Applebees nearby. Good food reccomendations by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected great place!! Certainly worth staying at!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaked007
Reviews.Content: We were sort of apprehensive at first when driving to the hotel. The neighborhood isn't very inviting and the next-door shopping center is second rate. However, once we crossed the threshold, everything changed. We were greeted with a wide smile which lasted for our whole stay. The room was beautifully designed, spotlessly clean and roomy. The hotel is a mere four minute walk fro the closest underground station (Andrew), which was great. whatever directions we asked for, the staff would pull ut a ready-printed note with full and clear explanations. Lots of parking place (free). There is no need to pay double (at least) downtown for less. take my word - This is the best deal for Boston visitors!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for price”
Reviews.Author: Duvallor
Reviews.Content: Courtyard South Boston is recommended if you are looking for a place to stay not necessary downtown Boston (15 min by metro) at reasonable price with safe free parking and close to public transport. Not much to do close to hotel (restaurants, etc), so get a public transport pass for the duration your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mttee
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated and comfortable rooms. The price was very reasonable. The beds were super comfortable with good sheets and lots of fluffy pillows. I had requested extra pillows and I think we had 6 on each bed. Very clean. Since we had a car the free parking was definately a plus as parking in Boston is expensive. I did have a problem getting to and from the hotel though - GPS doesn't seem to want to find it.. I don't think I came or went the same way twice, lol. I knew once I spotted Best Buy that I was close! Breakfast was good although nothing special. I booked the breakfast "package" and there was some confusion about payment. Apparently they are supposed to give you vouchers but I didn't get any on checkin. Issue was resolved though. Overall a good experience and I would stay here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: sunfired_
Reviews.Content: From the moment of check-in until check-out, this hotel exceeded our expectations. Klarens was superior in customer service, very knowledgable about everything we needd to know and simply the most friendly and courteous front desk attenant we had for our entire week long vacation. George was equally as friendly and courteous and we appreciated his offers of assitance that were above and beyond anything expected. We sincerely hope the Manager of this hotel recognizes what valuable employees he has with these two at the front desk! The hotel was very clean and neat, which is a compliment to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are very nice and good sized. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates an extremely courteous staff and a very nice hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Park your car for Free, Ride the T -”
Reviews.Author: jkmsmiles
Reviews.Content: Free Parking! We lucked out with our $90 P-line bid. Currently only floors 5+6 have been renovated, not just surface paint and TV. It was like a new hotel room. The staff went the extra mile and handled our reservation transition (a P-line reservation, plus the extension). They also offered us complimentary laundry soap and fabric softener. The hotel is a bit hard to find behind Best Buy... Great business center with free computers and printing. A bit about me... I travel regularly and stay in everything from zero to 4 +stars... and Love a deal. This trip I was traveling with my husband through New England.

Reviews.Title: “We lucked out!”
Reviews.Author: REWEST
Reviews.Content: I'm so thrilled to see mostly positive reviews for this hotel. We booked through Priceline for $95.00/day, and were more than satisified with EVERYTHING about this location. Though removed from the "downtown" area, we actually enjoyed escaping to the gazebo in relative peace and quiet at night. This hotel was clean and comfortable with a great staff. One thing I would suggest is to have breakfast at the greasy spoon adjacent the Holiday Inn over the continental breakfast/buffet (It's an experience in itself). The shopping mall directly behind the hotel was most convenient. The area is certainly not Donald Trump land, but I never felt unsafe. To the contrary, the people in the area were very nice, and showed two tourists much love. For those who complained about this hotel, you'd probably complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: desertchick27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 4 teenage girls. most of the hotel staff was friendly. The morning gal needs to smile. The evening staff was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were roomy, comfy and clean. The hotel is located with in walking distance to the T. There is a Target behind the hotel which was very convenient. You can get to downtown on the T in 15 min. We went to a Red Sox game and took the T. It takes about 30 min from hotel to park. not too bad. The pool room was very hot! made it uncomfortable for us watching the girls swim. they had a little lounge area with a small bar, pool table and sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 2 nights of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelingfamily20104
Reviews.Content: We shorten our stay. The AC was very loud and kept us up the entire night. On top of that, the thermostat was inaccurate... The coffee maker was broken too. At checkout, I told the lady about our issues, she didn't say much and acted like she was used to hearing about complaints. This was the worst Mariott we stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: PadparadschaBE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the courtyard Boston - South Boston over a weekend trip to visit with some friends in Boston. I wasn't too sure about the location, because it seemed as if it was a bit outside the city, but I had nothing to worry about! The hotel is very nice - rooms were very comfortable. The hotel is also right next to a shopping area with some big box stores - Target, Best Buy, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelBumm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with two friends, chose this hotel to be our base while visiting Boston for some sight-seeing, shopping, and concert going. The $5 shuttle to and from the airport was quite convenient, as is the hotel's proximity to a subway station. The walk to the subway station is basically through a residential neighbourhood that seems decent and ends near a Dunkin' Donuts. On the other side of the hotel is a "big box" store plaza - Target, Best Buy, Home Depot, etc, which was nice and convenient. The hotel staff were quite friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and big. There is no restaurant, though they do serve breakfast. We did not try it, but Bickford's nearby has a great breakfast. Room service is provided by a nearby restaurant, and while the food was really good, there was some menu confusion since they had recently updated their menu and the hotel did not change the ones in the rooms. Our concert and shopping took us away from Boston, so we needed to rent a car for a few days. The free parking at the hotel was a nice bonus to this. Not being downtown, you are a little out of the action and "nightlife". But for the price and closeness to the subway station, this shouldn't matter too much!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolstar6
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston on the 29th of May till the 4th of June with my mother and we absolutely adored it. I was somewhat dubious about this hotel as we had read that it is in a rather unsavory area. The hotel is situated just outside the main city centre but takes all of 5 minutes to get into central Boston from Andrew Station which is about a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel. The area surrounding the hotel is just residential, there isnt much there to be honest, although we did happen to find a great restaurant round the corner for breakfast. The hotel was clean, spacious and the rooms were an amazing size and standard considering it was only a three star hotel. The hotel staff went beyond the call of duty to help us brits find our way around Boston and we couldnt have done a lot of it without the help of the reception staff. The only minor complaint I had, was eating in the restaurant for breakfast etc was very expensive and although the food was good we didnt do it again. Another small niggle was we were told there was a shuttle bus that picks you up from the airport, that is true but you need to ring the hotel first. Maybe it is slightly naive of us but we assumed that the bus would just be there, we were unaware that we had to call first and ending up spending 20 dollars on a cab. I'm pretty certain this was just our stupidity though! We loved Boston and we wpuld definately stay at this hotel again. It was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kiikii01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated. Very close to the subway which is only a few stops to the downtown area. The Hotel was very clean and the staff courteous. Parking is free and it's a great value for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good place to stay :)”
Reviews.Author: marciax3
Reviews.Content: i stayed here w/ my boyfriend and we just wanted a weekend getaway. this particular hotel happens to be very close to stores (best buy, target, etc) and a few restaurants (olive garden, applebees). so you really don't even need a car since your needs are within walking distance, but if you do drive, you're next to the highway basically and there's free parking. the pluses: *free* internet... the location is pretty damn convenient w/ restaurants and major stores next door basically... jacuzzi's in a few rooms... decent decor.... comfy beds.... spacious enuf so you don't feel claustrophobic. the negatives: pool and hot tub are pretty small... the breakfast buffet offered is average, nothing special... the heat/ac unit isn't all that great.... towels are kinda rough. overall, the location is what won me over. we didn't have to go anywhere significantly far lol. it's pretty quiet, not a lot of noise from cars or people. really, i wouldn't mind coming back here in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, or as near as you're going to get”
Reviews.Author: HeadofLogistics
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a two week trip to the USA from the UK. Where shall I start? The only not so good thing about the hotel is finding it by road but after that it was perfect. No charge to park the car, really very friendly and helpful staff, clean everywhere, free internet access, big room, blackout curtains, good bathroom, fridge, coffee maker, the market place shopping area (sells milk, essential if your 6 year old likes milk and cookies for supper), small swimming pool, self service laundry (another plus when travelling with young children), bar, fab buffet breakfast, 5 minute walk to the T (we had no problems with this, even after dark) and then about 10 minutes into central Boston, wonderful view of central Boston from 6th floor room, and supermarkets and restaurants on adjoining retail park. The front desk staff can even post your postcards for you! We stayed in a central Boston hotel for the first two nights of our trip. Whilst that location was maybe better, the Courtyard by Marriott was by far the better hotel all round. Well done to everyone there, I am a fan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zenakitty1
Reviews.Content: After I arrived in Boston, I was taken by taxi to the Courtyard Hote. When I entered the lobby I noticed how clean and well decorated it was. I was greeted by a very pleasant desk clerk that was courteous and extremely helpful. I had alot of luggage and the desk clerk helped me drag my suitcases to the room. My daughter arrived there before I had and since I called ahead they allowed her to be in the room before I arrived. I mentioned to the desk clerk that we wanted to go to Cheers and about 1/2 hr. she called us and said that she had gotten us a cab. How thoughful was that. The room was very clean and had a very nice smell to it. The bathroom was also spotless. The beds were soft and comfortable and the room was well decorated. My opinion of a great hotel is one that treats everyone with respect and dignity no matter what they look like. I myself was dressed like an Eskimo since I live in a state that does not get snow I wanted to be prepared for the weather. I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff goes out of their way to make you comfortable, and cater to your wishes. When we checked out of the hotel we were provided with maps and directions to our next destination. They took their time to go over it with us. We had a very pleasant experience with this hotel and we certainly will stay with them again. Two thumbs up for this hotel and their staff Jean

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: schmidt64
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in South Boston! Had a rental car so can't really comment on ease of finding public transit. Stayed there for 6 nights in mid-March and have no regrets at all. Free parking and internet were major perks and were a big reason why we stayed here. Rooms were clean, staff was helpful and the nearby Target was awesome for saving a few bucks on meals during out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Money”
Reviews.Author: bkn4986
Reviews.Content: Though this wasn't the grandest hotel in all of Boston, it was the best value for the money hands down. First of all, the free parking is totally worth it. Most hotels had a hidden mandatory valet parking fee so the free parking is a HUGE selling point. The rooms were very clean, newer, and a good size. The pool and hot tub were clean and very well kept. I would not recommend this hotel for families with lots of kids. The hotel seems more for a crowd that is looking for peace and quiet. The pool/hot tub area is small, but great for couples. The lobby has a nice bar area and a free computer station (awesome!) but would not be an appropriate place for children to be let loose. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I know some complain about the location, but in all reality, we had no problems whatsoever. Our GPS found it perfectly fine, the T station is literally a 3-4 minute walk, and you pass a Dunkin Donuts right on the way if you want to grab a quick breakfast before heading into the city. The restaurant that does the food delivery for the hotel is 224 Boston. That restaurant is delicious! If you don't want to order in and pay the delivery prices, the restaurant is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and safe enough to walk to. I recommend the lobster mac n' cheese or the salmon. We later found out that restaurant is ranked among some of the best in Boston. We had an excellent stay and I am sure you will too! P.S. I REALLY don't recommend this hotel for families with tons of kids or very little kids. Not the right environment.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, but on the rong side of town :(”
Reviews.Author: layne4120
Reviews.Content: First off let me tell you that it is EXTREMLY hard to get into this hotel! You have to go through the Target parking lot in order to get into the hotels lot. This took us forever to figure out because mapquest and GPS dont have that as the route. All of the other entrances are one-way roads that you cannot enter onto. We were visiting Boston for a spring break road trip and chose this hotel because it was cheap and looked nice. Although it was very nice and new, it is in more of an industrial part of town. It is more suited for a business person or someone who knows the city pretty well. I never felt unsafe persay, just a little un-easy at times. Once we took the subway into the main part of Boston we realized that we chose the wrong side of town to stay in. The staff was extremly friendly and the pool was very nice! Also, the internet was faster then my home computer! The rooms are very well appointed, and the beds were really comfy. We also had a pretty cool view of the Boston skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Different part of town”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to stay at this hotel for some time. Have been following the Tripadvisor reviews and was disappointed to see it fell 20 places down the rankings. But still decided to try it to see what it was like. Tripadvisor reviewers were right to say it's not in the most pleasant areas of town. But in the daytime, it looks safe, and the walk from Andrew Station is relatively short. From Andrew, you are 2 stops from South Station, where you can take the Silver Line Bus to Logan Airport. I was disappointed when I checked in, that I only got a low floor, when I specified on my reservation that I preferred a high floor. This is not the 1st hotel where that has happened, but it makes you wonder if front desk has the same information in their computer that you have on your reservation. The room was huge, twice the size of rooms I'm used to. I was afraid I might be under a family of kids but it was relatively quiet during my 2-night stay. But I only had a view of one side of the carpark. I don't think front desk gave me the best room available at the time. And it is not cheap. $119 a night plus tax for this part of town, I paid less for being closer to downtown. The hotel is within walking distance to the South Bay Shopping Center, which has a lot of shops, including Target, Home Depot and Best Buy. The room has a fridge that is so cold you don't need ice for your drinks. Shower has the best shower pressure I'm experienced anywhere. Internet is free, which is a huge plus for me. There is a laundry room, which can come in handy. I think I would stay here again, if I got a cheaper rate. And I would request at check-in to be on a higher floor next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: blaugelb75
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at a decent price ($89) in a notoriously expensive city. Very welcoming, rooms are clean and has a sofa and fridge too. Roomy too, which helps with its location being out of the way and therefore more room. Only real minus point was that the bar closes at 10pm latest. That said, Applebee's next door closes at 11.30pm. Situated next to a mall with Target, Best Buy, Stop and Shop (though none sell liquor). Shuttle to/from Logan is well worth $5 each way, although it also serves the Holiday Inn Express next door too. Which can be annoying if somebody is dawdling with their car beforehand... It's a little bit out of the way from downtown Boston, although with the T-Line only 5-10 minute walk away it's not that bad. Fortunately, Andrew (the T-line station) has a lift/elevator too. Area is not upmarket (it's in a predominantly Polish area, though with the usual Irish contingent in Southie) but perfectly safe. All in all, worth staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 3star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariehd1985
Reviews.Content: We reserve 2 connected room. Both room were really clean with comfy beds. No negative point about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - staff so helpful and friendly - lovely spacious room”
Reviews.Author: bumskin Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel - when we arrived the manager welcomed us and explained the T and that our nearest stop was Andrew. The room was wonderful and spacious with a large bathroom, an iron and ironing board, and plenty of space to sit and watch TV. The breakfast was really good and the food fresh - delighted to see fruit on the menu for breakfast and the eggs were not overcooked. I cannot fault anything about the staff, quality of service about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and wide.”
Reviews.Author: å¤§è”µ
Reviews.Content: I stayed standard twin room. It was clean and wide that I could stay comfortable. Many company branches and restaurant were around there so if you have a car ( of course ), no problem with the location. Breakfast was ok, many kinds of fruit and bread. Big TV, sofa, newspaper are in lobby so you can also kill time there.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: OhGreatOne
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the reviews, I was expecting the worst. We weren't able to book a hotel downtown on an October weekend. The cheapest price for a three-star was twice what we had paid for a four-star in August 2008. Once school is in, the availability of hotel rooms just evaporates in Boston and the prices skyrocket. Nothing in this hotel will be the best you've ever seen. You will not have the best view, the best food, the best location, or the best rooms you've ever stayed in. You won't tell your friends that they just HAVE to stay in this hotel when they come to Boston the next time. That being said, this hotel is just fine. The rooms are spacious, clean and new. All amenities (e.g. free internet) are taken nicely accounted for. You'll sleep well in these beds. Free parking is another cost to consider when comparing to downtown hotels. The hotel itself seems to be in a safe if nondescript neighbourhood. If you want to take the subway, the station itself (Andrews Square) has some grubby-looking characters milling around that one will see in any big city and other most parts of Boston, but no one gave us any trouble or even asked for spare change. If you're not accustomed to big cities, or are elderly or a single woman walking alone, it might be wise to cab it after dark, but that could go for just about anywhere in Boston outside Fannueil Hall. I'd reiterate what an earlier poster said about directions to this hotel. If you are driving, get your directions directly from the hotel website. Do NOT use google maps or the like. Type in the hotel address into Google maps and you'll arrive a mile or so south of the hotel. We grabbed a taxi twice at night from around Boston Common back to the hotel and the fare was less than $11 before tip each time (no traffic to speak of) so it's not too far away even if you initially think the hotel's in the middle of nowhere. All in all, a very satisfactory hotel and in many respects more comfortable than a renowned hotel we stayed at in Boston a little more than a year ago.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: knew
Reviews.Content: "We were pleasantly surprised after reading previous reviews and had such a good experience we felt compelled to write our own. The walk to the subway was my big concern as we did not have a renal car until halfway through our stay. At no time did we encounter anyone who was suspicious, nor was there any loitering going on. We went to a night game at Fenway, rode the T home and did not meet anyone on our walk back to the hotel. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and helpful wtih directions every time we asked a question-which was frequently! We never had to ask for linens, always had extra. I did notice dust in the room, otherwise very clean.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: likestogoontrips
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this trip to Boston but the trip was marred by the disappointment in this hotel. There was a stale smell, breakfast was very overpriced, it was in a terrible location and had poor access to transportation, you always had to ask for linens--I could go on and on. I wished I had looked further before choosing this hotel. My sister had recommended Marriott but I will never stay with them again. I usually enjoy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Boston”
Reviews.Author: KarlLeesSummit_MO
Reviews.Content: First of all, the address didn't work in my garmin and the place is hard to find even thought it is right off the freeway. Type in 14 allstate rd, Dorchester, MA. That is the Best Buy and if you go behind the Best Buy, there you are. The hotel has free parking which is a definate bonus for Boston. The city has a great subway system that will take you anywhere. Just walk across the lot go up the curvy road to boston street. Go left a few blocks and you will see a Dunkin Donut. The subway is just to the right of the donut shop. I don't think it is in the best neighborhood so be aware when you are out walking. The hotel was nice. Our room was a king with a couch and it had a little refrigerator. For the money, great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not a great option if you need to be downtown a lot.”
Reviews.Author: drywalsman
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean place. Looked fairly new. Service was great. Was always greeted as I came in the door. Great indoor pool/hot tub. about the only downside was the location. the hotel was located in an area you probably wouldn't want to do a lot of walking in and it was a $20-30 cab ride to downtown each time. They do have a shuttle to and from the airport for $5. Good stay. Would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sorinakis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to a shopping mall, subway and I93. The rooms are clean and spacious but the front desk staff can be more friendly :). The travel time to downtown 6-8minutes drive, not in rush hours. Overall a good place to stay that offers you complementary parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel stay, close to the T, great pool”
Reviews.Author: vermonterk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my kids for a weekend. We went to the Aquarium and the Museum of Science. The hotel is 3 blocks from Andrews station on the red line, making it very easy to get into the city to all the attractions. It's just south of Boston, the exit is where you come out of the tunnel (if heading South) so it's easy to get to. And to get free parking in Boston made it immediately $40 cheaper than the others right in the city. The hotel was spotless, the breakfast was great, the pool was also very nice. Small, but well-kept and it looks new. We loved it and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lstenbeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our flight out of Boston Logan. The staff was extremely helpful from the font desk to the shuttle drivers. The shuttle was on time and comfortable. The room was spacious and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston South”
Reviews.Author: jassmiley
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, short 5 minute walk to the T Redline or if shuttle is around, they will drop you off. Rooms were nice size and bed comfoprtable. Pool, is small only 3 and 4 feet deep. Free parking is always a plus in boston. Cookies were great. Overall a great stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: Check in fast despite arriving behind the complimentary airport shuttle bus. Very helpful staff during stay. Large modern updated decor rooms with nice baths, comfortable bedding and well illuminated baths. Free internet. Short walk to metro (though not the best of neighborhoods), plenty of free parking and a nearby shopping center. A good choice for a visit to Boston. Negatives: Almost impossible to get a taxi to pick you up here (though drop off not a problem).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodChris
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for the weekend and were very happy. I was the first to arrive so I can set up our room for my friend's bachelorette party and when I went into my room I had a view I wasn't happy with. It was directly aligned with the vents so that's all you saw when you opened the curtains. I was in a rush and the staff behind the desk were very nice enough to switch our room for a better view of the city. The room was very nice and clean and I really loved the decor. The beds were extremely comfortable and come with 5 comfy pillows on each one. The bathroom was nice and the shower had a bench in it which was a bonus (3 girls with LOTS of toiletries to hold)! The pool was open until 11pm which was great! It was not quite deep enough (about 4ft) but it was def nice to swim in and very clean. For the price it was a great deal. It's right outside the city but it only takes about 10 minutes to get to Boston's fun destinations. Next time I come to Boston I'm probably going to stay somewhere within walking distance to everything, but I would def consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth start/end point for trips”
Reviews.Author: grayesun
Reviews.Content: We've done the Park & Fly several times now out of this Courtyard with fine results every time. The rooms/furnishings are typical Courtyard, very clean, well maintained and spacious enough for our needs. The shuttle service to/from the airport is quick and reliable; only problem we've had was with PM front desk person not properly logging in our wake-up or shuttle service request last time and the AM desk person was surprised when we showed up for the morning shuttle service and informed him we'd not received a wake-up call either. Fortunately he was able to gin up a van for us in less than 5 minutes and we were off to the airport on time. Excellent performance under pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Raimania
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Excellent location - about a 5 minute walk from the Andrew Sq T station. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel has a maximum guests of 4 but we're a family with 3 young kids. no problem at chek in. We took the package with breakfast (10$ more ) which was great cause the kids eat for free. We felt very safe walking to the T station. I'll recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: k8tangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Excellent location - about a 5 minute walk from the Andrew Sq T station. Check in was very quick, although the clerk spoke very fast and not very clearly. The room was clean and comfortable. Bedding was great! When I made my reservation, I asked for extra pillows and they were there waiting for me. The breakfast buffet didn't look very inviting for $13 so we went to Bickfords which was in the same parking lot. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & EZ walk to subway”
Reviews.Author: jne1119
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. The room was clean and well appointed. The hotel provides free transportation to/from the airport and the subway is an easy 5 minute walk. And since we stayed for a week and didn't have a car, it was also convenient to have a shopping center within walking distance. We did have a couple of "bumps" in our stay though... The ride from the airport was only 10 minutes but unfortuantely it was a 40 minute wait before we were picked up. We had a problem with the ride back to the airport as well. We called the front desk the night before to request pick up in the lobby at 9:30am, unfortunately, our ride left without us because our name wasn't on the list for pick up for some reason. I have to say, the front desk clerk was very sympathetic and sprung to action. He called a cab company and said the hotel would pick up the tab. And when the cab company was taking too long, he arranged for another staff member to drive us in the hotel van...so we made our flight in time. Our only other complaint was the breakfast. The food was mediocre and overpriced, and the service was terrible. Overall, all that being said, I still would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with friends while the Yankees were in town. I was a little hesitant, because it was "out of the action", but there was nothing disappointing about this Courtyard. The location was great -- the Andrew T-stop was a 5 minute walk away, making it easy to get into the city and transfer to the various lines. The hotel grounds were very well maintained and the rooms were decently sized. We had one problem with the air conditioner in our room the first night (it wasn't working), but I asked the front desk to send an engineer up to look into it the next morning, and by the time we returned Friday night, the room was completely cool and we didn't have any problems for the rest of the stay. ALL the staff was very friendly. The front desk staff even remembered my name when I would come down to the lobby. That's near impossible to find these days. They were helpful with maps, finding late night delivery dining, small inconveniences, etc. You name it, they can handle it, and with a smile! The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport every half hour on the hour. This was a great ammenity and had a lot to do with my decision to stay at this property. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MsLibrarian
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, and very comfortable. The bench in the shower is very nice touch. I loved everything about the room. The hotel has a huge lounge area with a pool table and bar. Internet capabilities in room and in the lounge area. Shuttle service which I didn't get a chance to use is very useful. The only drawback is that the hotel sits outside of Boston, so you would have to drive into the city, take the subway or take a cab. We took a cab at night into the city which only took about 10 minutes if that, so that's not bad at all. The neighborhood doesn't look like Beacon Hill, but their is a shopping center next door. I usually prefer to stay right in the heart of everything, but for the price it was a good bargain. However, next time I think we will stay somewhere around Copley Square or Beacon Hill, just to be in walking distance of everything. O yeah, I highly recommend Panificio (Charles St) for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from July 3, 2008 until July 6, 2008 in room 633. Overall, we were very pleased with the accommodations and would definitely stay here again. Our stay started off well. We called for the free shuttle van pick-up from the airport and it arrived within about 15 minutes, the time it takes to get to the hotel. The hotel appears to have been built recently and most everything looked new. Check-in took about 1 minute and we were given a room on a high floor, which had a nice view of the Boston skyline (we were able to watch the fireworks from our window). The room was only average-sized, but was very clean and had all the basic amenities you might need. The room temperature was controlled by a digital thermostat and the AC worked great. The television had a very large channel selection. The bed was comfortable, but Iâ€™ve slept on softer mattresses at other Courtyards before. The pillows were soft and numerous. The bathroom was very clean and of average size. The room also had a refrigerator and the carpeting and sheets appeared to be very new. This hotel is not in the downtown area, but we got a very good rate for that very reason. The Andrew T stop was only a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and just two stops from downtown Boston. It is very possible to be in downtown Boston within 15-20 minutes from the moment you walk out of your hotel room. For this minor inconvenience you can save a lot of money on your hotel room and not have to pay for a taxi from the airport. I found the area to be quite safe and the comments from other reviewers about the area are overblown. Right next door to the hotel is a shopping center where you can eat at Applebeeâ€™s, Olive Garden, or shop at Stop N Shop, Target, Marshallâ€™s, Best Buy, or Old Navy. We recommend taking the 16 bus from the Andrew station (or in front of the Stop N Shop) to the Franklin Park Zoo (contrary to the sign at the corner of Washburn and Boston Streets, it does not stop there). Adult admission is only $12.00 and the bus ride was 15 minutes. The hotel also had a nice pool and hot tub area that was open until 10:00 pm every night. The pool water was not cold and the hot tub temperature was just right. The staff was very friendly. When I asked if there was a microwave in the lobby area, the concierge offered to have one delivered to my room, which they did 10 minutes later. The hotel also had two free internet stations for guests to use and a free coffee stand. We did not use the fitness room, which was open 24/7. Maid service was excellent. The grounds were nicely landscaped and impeccably clean. Iâ€™m not sure what I paid per night. I purchased a vacation package on Priceline.com (4 days/3 nights, fees, taxes, and roundtrip airfare for 2 from NYC for only $660.00 total). I just know I got a very good rate and I would absolutely stay here again. This was not the Four Seasons, but it was a great value for the accommodations we received. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “More than excellent”
Reviews.Author: freddyfreeloader
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Mariot s.Boston.Better than excellent value for super nice clean and spacious rooms, with all the amenities and then some.Highly recommended.Shuttle to and from logan airport,usa today news paper fridge in room cofee etc etc. very friendly staff and beds cleaner than my own.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cohusker
Reviews.Content: I wanted a place to stay that was inexpensive and close to a subway station so I could sight-see in Boston. This place fit the bill as it was only $99/night with AAA discount. The hotel is in an "ok" area. I didn't feel scared in anyway. There is a shopping center very close by and the subway station is about 3 blocks away (close enough to walk). There is also a free shuttle to/from the airport which we didn't use. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wanted a place to stay that is close to downtown Boston and isn't over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but strange area”
Reviews.Author: 4travelva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. Rooms are clean! Beware though this hotel is in a strange area. We were told that the hotel was very close to the metro station; however it is three blocks. I know this does not sound like its far, but you have to walk through a residential area and over a bridge. We had small children and felt uncomfortable coming back at night. The metro station near the hotel is not the best, smelled of urine and a little scary for families. The front desk was nice and did give us a free breakfast for not being as 'truthful' as we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all-around hotel in a weird location”
Reviews.Author: festiboi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Boston South for my first ever trip to Boston. Was looking forward to the hotel after reading the rave reviews and was prepared for the location away from downtown.
