The shuttle service was pretty fast at picking us up from Logan and took us straight to the hotel. We were informed that the shuttle only runs to the airport, and would not run us to downtown. However, the front desk staff had in-depth, printed directions on how to walk to the nearest train station (Andrew) which was only five minutes away. The area around the hotel was somewhat quirky. It was semi-industrial and residential, and located close to a huge shopping centre with a Target and Old Navy. We walked to downtown on Massachusetts Ave several times, and even though it was a somewhat run-down area, we didn't feel unsafe or in harms way. However, there were homeless people and a meth clinic along the way, so it is somewhat dodgy. The walk to the train station was easy and very safe. The rooms were very clean and in good shape. Beds were comfortable, the pillows were perfect, and the decor was nice. The views weren't great, and were mostly of the 93, but we weren't in the room enough to care. The only other quirk was a lack of blankets on the beds. Nights can be a little chill The staff was very helpful and was always polite and courteous. The accomodated us by holding our luggage after check out until our evening flight and arranged for Enterprise-Rent-A-Car to deliver a car for us at the hotel. Huge kudos to them! Another HUGE perk was plentiful free parking, which wouldn't be possible in a downtown hotel. Finally, the restaurant had a breakfast buffet that was $12.95 and considering that it was a hotel restaurant (where prices are usually exagerrated), it wasn't a bad deal. There were waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, muffins, fruit, and bagels. The waitress was interesting. The first day we ate there she was extremely attentive and was very fast. She had excellent service and was very friendly. The second day we ate there she was stressed over an issue in the kitchen as we would hear her screaming in Spanish in there, and was forgetful of our orders and dumped all her personal problems on us. Not the most relaxing breakfast. Overall, the Marriott Courtyard was an excellent hotel with clean rooms, wonderful front-line staff, and stellar service. The location wasn't a huge deal for us, but if you get nervous of dark streets with homeless people, then it's not a good walk, but the train is close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly not impressed”
Reviews.Author: TheBigEZ
Reviews.Content: Though still far better than the discount hotel chains, this is the worst Courtyard I've stayed in. The room stunk and it was a little confusing to find the entrance. Fortunately I only had to stay one night. I will pay a bit more for another brand in the Marriot chain next time Iâ€™m in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: NHLeen
Reviews.Content: Above average Courtyard - from a traveller who is afraid of anything other than a 4 Seasons or a Ritz, this hotel, with its Park/Sleep/Fly package, is a great option if you have an early morning flight out of Logan. Built about 3 years ago, the rooms are Marriot grade, well above typical Courtyards. Shuttle prompt & friendly, even at 5 am. Lobby coffee ready at that hour, as well. 7 minute walk to the T, but you won't want to walk it at night - daytime is fine. Suburban style strip mall right behind the hotel is convenient for kids - Target, Old Navy, Applebees & Olive Garden are all right there. This hotel could easily be branded a Marriot, and may be once they put the planned full service restaurant into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: March 10, 2008 â€“ I had the opportunity to spend one night at the Courtyard hotel in South Boston. Every aspect of my stay met or exceeded my expectations. The hotel is only about 5 Â½ miles South of Boston Logan Airport. However, picking up my rental car at about 5:00 PM, it took about a half hour to get to my hotel due rush hour traffic and my not being familiar with the area. A landmark to look out for when heading to the hotel is the large square storage building that tries to look like a fortress. The hotel is very close by. The entrance of the hotel is dramatic, especially by Courtyard standards. There is plenty of free parking all around the hotel. Check-in was â€œMarriott fast,â€� taking less than a minute. I had reserved a King room which was guaranteed and requested a high floor. My room, #429 met both requirements. I was able to get an AAA rate of $139 per night which I thought was very good. My room was beautiful. The dÃ©cor is contemporary and comfortable. The king bed was very comfortable and had a selection of both feather and poly-fill pillows. There were night stands and wall mounted lights on each side of the bed. I appreciated the fact that there was an outlet on the lamp into which I could plug my cell phone. Across from the bed was a large unit which contained the clothes closet, held the TV, and was also the work desk. The TV had a large number of cable channels, but I was surprised that there was no Pay Per View programming. The desk had a very comfortable office-style chair. The hotel offers complimentary high speed internet service via a Cat 5 cable. I was able to connect to our company VPN easily. Running the Speakeasy Internet Speed Test showed a download speed of just over 1MBPS and an upload speed of about 700KBPS, reasonable fast. Opposite the desk were a queen-size sofa bed, coffee table, and floor lamp. The couch was comfortable, but I did not try the sofa bed. Lighting in the room was very good. From the window I could see the back side of a mall and downtown Boston in the far distance. The hotel restaurant is only open for breakfast, but the hotel has an arrangement with a local restaurant for room service. I did not try the room service, but did have breakfast at the hotel the next morning. The breakfast buffet was $10.95 and included cooked-to-order eggs and omelets. There was also a good selection of breakfast buffet items. The hotel is located in primarily a residential neighborhood. The homes are fairly old, but it seemed like a nice neighborhood to me. If it had not been below freezing, I would have walked around. All aspects of service at the Courtyard were excellent. I asked for directions to get back on the freeway and instead of handing me a map, the front desk associate took me outside and pointed out the way to go which I thought was an example of great service. I was very pleased with my stay at the Courtyard in South Boston. I would go back and recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great!!”
Reviews.Author: mommy2many
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was great. They brought the adults larger towels at the pool instead of making us use the small thin one. The waitress at breakfast was fantastic. She keep the kids very happy. The location of the hotel is not great if you are doing things in the city but we just went the parade in South Boston so we were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great staff for the most part”
Reviews.Author: bking406
Reviews.Content: We checked in the hotel for one night on March 10th. Arrived at Logan and shuttle was at the airport to pick us up 20 minutes after we called. We arrived at the hotel and there was one front desk agent. She never greeted us , never said anything really. I finally said we wanted to check in . She said name, never looking at me. Then she asked for my credit card, again never looking at me, never recognizing me as a silver elite, nothing. She gave me my credit card back , handed me my key , and never said a word. She didnt tell me the room number, she didnt say anything , I asked for the room number and she pointed at the key pack. We were hoping the whole experience would not be as cold and unfriendly as this one woman was. We got in the room. It was very nice, clean and spacious. Throughtout the rest of the stay , the other front desk staff and other staff members of the hotel were very friendly and attentive, which is why I will not let this one person spoil my review for the hotel. Thats why i ranked it excellent. Everyone else went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we were satisfied. Thanks Courtyard South Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Transitional Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work, and stay at Marriott-brand properties about 125 nights a year. I've learned what to expect from these hotels. This Courtyard is one of the nicest I have stayed in, anywhere. From the outside, it's really beautiful and upscale, MUCH moreso than you'd expect from this brand. The lobby and pool and also really beautiful. My room was standard-issue Coutyard 2007, meaning lots of creamy wallpaper, attractive furniture, and a nice bed. The bathroom was also great. The room was sparkling clean. Overall, the property itself is terrific....BUT, step off the property and it's a different story. It's located in one of those neighborhoods that realtors politely call "transitional." Looking out of the hotel in one direction is an old factory that looks like it's been abandoned for decades, the back of a Best Buy in the other direction, the hotel parking lot in a third direction, and the back of an old Howard Johnson's in a fourth direction. I got lost a few blocks from the hotel, and when I called for help, the front desk person asked if I was "next to the projects." Next door to the hotel is a really nice, new Power Center mall with a Target, Best Buy, Olive Garden, supermarket, Applebee's, etc. The convention center is also a fairly close drive, especially if you learn the back route to get there. It seems as though the city has worked hard to redevelop this area, but the hotel and the adjacent strip mall are about the only bright spots for many blocks in all directions. Loved the hotel, but the location kills the place. What a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great value, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: traveler122126
Reviews.Content: My room at the Courtyard South Boston was extremely clean as well as roomy and well appointed. The wireless internet was fast and easy to access. The fitness room was small but adequate, and all of the equipment was in good repair. Possibly the most memorable aspect of my stay was the helpfulness and courtesy of the staff. The shuttle bus drivers were kind enough to drop me off at the closest metro stop (about a 10-minute walk away) on several occasions and also pick me up from the station. I also used the complimentary airport shuttle and was pleasantly surprised by how quickly the shuttle arrived at the airport. I'll definitely consider staying here again on my next Boston trip!

Reviews.Title: “A great Place to Stay for young ones!”
Reviews.Author: daddy_oca
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young girls (6 and 9) as well as another couple with kids close to the same age arrived in Boston on Dec 30 for a couple of nights and a Boston Bruins game. After an 8 hr drive the staff at the front desk were great. They were very friendly and things were handled quickly. Our rooms were basic but clean and nice. The pool is very easy to access through the lobby and we immediately went there with 4 young ones. The pool was a little small for them, however, that was ok. (be careful though it is a little slippery on the deck...why pools do that???) The kids like the pool regardless. We felt very at ease there and even brought a few beer (in cans) to sip on while kids were in pool and we sat in hot tub. As for getting around Boston and to the game, front desk had a little direction sheet telling us how to walk to the TTC or 'T' as they call it. It was about a 10 minute walk (if that) to the 'T' and before we knew it we were at the Bruins game. Not only were the people nice at the hotel, everyone we talked to in Boston were very very friendly. After the game, some police officers gave us directins to Cheers and we had a ball! MInd you everything is a two minute walk to Boston people... perhaps the Boston Marathon mentality? A little long of a walk, but my 6 yr old handled it on a chilly New Years Eve. The breakfast was fantastic. The nice man at the front desk gave us a deal for the first morning since we were so 'nice' haha and had such a long drive. It was a buffet and 'Mercedez', the waitress, is fantastic. Thank you for everything Mercedez! Needless to say, a very healthy and tasty breakfast. The only problem with the hotel is the tricky spot it sits and trying to find it. It is located behind a mall, and if you see a sign for Holiday Inn, then that is it. Courtyard needs a BIGGER SIGN!!!! Other than that, a great stay! thanks Boston Chris Shannon [--] would be happy to tell more

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mokelley
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a Friday night wedding in Boston Harbor Hotel. I booked our room directly from the Marriott website for the same price as Hotwire and Expedia ( but ,without their extra fees= $79. + tax). I also received a AAA discount and extra Marriott reward points, as well. The first room was beautiful, but had a very noisy heater. The manager responded immediately and gave us another room with a city view. The staff were helpful giving us driving directions into the city using access roads to avoid rush hour traffic. Next day we found a perfect breakfast stop:Victoria's Diner on 1024 Mass. Ave. that had the best tasting veggie omelts, home fries, coffee---it seems this diner has been a local favorite for almost 60 years.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: cqrt
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this property in past 6 months - -staff polite, hotel very clean and well equipped-- wi-fi, in-room coffee makers, USA newspaper and decent breakfast available . . great little neighborhood Italian restaurant about 6 blocks away called "224" that's worth the visit. Would have stayed again last night on a return for an early flight out, but they were oversold . . . Absolutely thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Harris
Reviews.Content: We got a great non-changeable rate of $189+ tax, when the rest of the Boston chain hotels seemed to be $300+. Good start when the free shuttle was at Logan to pick us up within a few minutes from phoning them from the courtesy phone. Hotel is right next to a Holiday Inn Express, which I believe is owned by the same franchise. It is also next door to the very big South Bay Shopping Complex, which features Best Buy, Target, Circuit City, Super Stop 'n' Shop, to name but a few - one good tip is that there is a free shuttle bus running between the shopping plaza and the Andrew T station - very good, especially if you have luggage. The hotel itself is fairly new and a typical Courtyard - very clean, not too roomy, but adequate. Free wi-fi and coffee in the lobby and free wired internet in the rooms. Staff were courteous and helpful. The area isn't too bad, no signs of graffiti or gang tags in what appeared to be a mainly Polish neighbourhood during the 10 minute walk to the T station. There is a Bickford's diner next to the hotel, and an Olive Garden and Applebee's in the shopping complex. All in all a good alternative to the mega prices of the city centre, but you are a bit 'out of the action'. Would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: tappin
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice if you will be attending conventions at the BCEC. The courtesy shuttle saved us a good bit in taxi fares to and from the BCEC and the airport. Rooms are big and clean and the staff wasalways helpful. About a $10-$12 cab ride to other areas of Boston such as the North End and Copley Square. The Target behind the hotel was convenient to pick up necessities and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: MMCHalifax
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about a 3 minute walk to the subway; South Boston mall is behind it; rooms were very nice; hotel staff were very friendly; took a cab after a game at Fenway and it cost $13; would stay here again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if travelling with car”
Reviews.Author: fmg120
Reviews.Content: i got a great rate and was looking for a place that i could park free and get around easily. this was right off rt93 and the 3 treks i made into the city on fri night,sat and sun morning to the childrens museum, aquarium and harbor were very driveable. the kids and i enjoyed the pool and work out area. breakfast was not included with my rate but there's a nice diner in an adjacent parking lot and a grocery store right behind. would have liked a microwave in the room but other than that, this hotel exceeded all our needs. would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, but not a great location for us”
Reviews.Author: Britgirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the start of August. The staff were generally very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had no complaints about the hotel itself other than the location. As two young British women, we found the neighbourhood wasn't good - even during the daytime. We were accosted by people regularly just on the walk to the T. We didn't feel particularly safe and it wasn't a great location for a holiday hotel when you don't have a car. ( We stayed later at the Holiday Inn Select, Government Centre, which was much better - It was central, you could walk pretty much everywhere and the Beacon Hill area was really nice too).

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Family_two_boys
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for six nights and really liked it - especially the proximity to "the T" (Boston's subway line). It was about a 10 minute walk to the subway with two small kids in tow, probably faster for unencumbered adults. It is 3 subway stops away from a centrally located subway stop called "Downtown Crossing". The room with 2 Queen sized beds was generous enough size-wise to allow our energetic 3 year old to run back and forth. Bathroom was clean. Trademark Marriott sparkling linens adorned the beds. One thing we really like about the Marriott chain is that they are entirely smoke-free. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the expensive breakfast - was about $12 per adult and they charge for all kids ($7 for kids). At other Marriotts that we have stayed at, kids under 4 eat free. But, there is a wonderfully divey diner nearby (Bickford's, right behind the adjacent Holiday Inn), which serves the best French Toast and is much more reasonably priced (although their coffee leaves something to be desired!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..”
Reviews.Author: octofire
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Courtyard South Boston this year. The hotel is an excellent pre-vacation choice for its park, sleep and fly package. The facility is extremely clean and very well appointed. Food and shopping are within walking distance. Very comfortable lounge, pool, and outdoor gazebo areas. Parking area security has greatly improved after earlier vandalism problems (we were a victim in February). I would definitely recommend.......

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Boston-South Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 63 R Boston Street, Boston, MA 02115
